column4: Low resolution, low frame rate (6fps) for digital cameras
Creative Video Blaster Webcam Go JPEG
Format similar to YV12 but including a level of indirection.
DirectX Compressed Texture (3bit alpha channel with interpolation)
D-Vision Field Encoded M-JPEG with LSI (or Targa emulation)
SoftLab-NSK Vision Forward M-JPEG with Alpha-channel
SoftLab-NSK Vision Forward M-JPEG with Alpha-channel
Huffman Lossless YUV and RGB formats (with Alpha-channel)
As YV12, except the U and V planes each have the same stride as the Y plane
Similar to IMC1, except that the U and V lines are interleaved at half stride boundaries
As IMC1, except that U and V are swapped
As IMC2, except that U and V are swapped
I-O Data Device Giga AVI DV
Lead 16bpp. Interlaced version of UYVY (line order 0, 2, 4,....,1, 3, 5....)
Lead 16bpp. Interlaced version of Y41P (line order 0, 2, 4,....,1, 3, 5....)
IEEE1394 12bpp. 12 bit format used in mode 2 of the IEEE 1394 Digital Camera 1.04 spec
IEEE1394 24bpp. 24 bit format used in mode 2 of the IEEE 1394 Digital Camera 1.04 spec
DIVIO JPEG Light for WebCams (Pegasus Lossless JPEG)
Infinop Lightning Strike multiple bit rate video codec.
Theory MicroCosm Lossless 64bit RGB with Alpha-channel
NewTek LightWave HDTV YUV with Alpha-channel
8-bit Y plane followed by an interleaved U/V plane with 2x2 subsampling
As NV12 with U and V reversed in the interleaved plane
Uncompressed w/ Alpha. Uncompressed RGB with alpha. Sample precision and packing is arbitrary and determined using bit masks for each component, as for BI_BITFIELDS.
RLE RGB with arbitrary sample packing within a pixel
REALmagic MPEG-4 Video (Sigma Design, built on XviD)
NewTek VideoToaster (dummy format - only AVI header)
ST Microelectronics CMOS Imager Data (Nudged Bayer)
ST Microelectronics CMOS Imager Data (Extended Data Format)
ST Microelectronics CMOS Imager Data (Extended Data Format with Correction Data)
Truevision TARGA M-JPEG Hardware (or Targa emulation)
Nvidia 16bpp. A direct copy of UYVY registered by Nvidia to work around problems in some olds which did not like hardware which offered more than 2 UYVY surfaces.
Evans & Sutherland 24bpp. YCbCr 4:2:2 extended precision 10-bits per component in U0Y0V0Y1 order
Uncompressed 16bpp. YUV 4:2:2 (Y sample at every pixel, U and V sampled at every second pixel horizontally on each line). A macropixel contains 2 pixels in 1 u_int32.
Vitec Multimedia YUV 4:2:2 as for UYVY, but with different component ordering within the u_int32 macropixel
Packed YUV format with Y sampled at every second pixel across each line and U and V sampled at every fourth pixel
Format as for Y41P, but the lsb of each Y component is used to signal pixel transparency
Direct copy of UYVY as used by ADS Technologies Pyro WebCam firewire camera
Format as for UYVY, but the lsb of each Y component is used to signal pixel transparency
A direct copy of YUY2 registered by Nvidia to work around problems in some olds which did not like hardware that offered more than 2 YUY2 surfaces
YCbCr 4:2:2 extended precision 10-bits per component in Y0U0Y1V0 order
YUV 4:2:2 as for UYVY but with different component ordering within the u_int32 macropixel
YUV 4:2:2 as for UYVY but with different component ordering within the u_int32 macropixel
